channel.title: Integrating Drafts with Notion using Automate.io
channel.description:
Hi there! I'm new to Drafts (and Automate). As a Notion user, I've decided to use Automate.io for API integrations since Notion just bought Automate
I was just wondering if there's a way to use Automate.io with Drafts? Apparently if Drafts supports Rest API then in theory it should be possible. Thanks!

item.title: Integrating Drafts with Notion using Automate.io
item.dc:creator: GS_Boss
item.description:
@melhopkop the steps in Automate.io should be to catch the upcoming webhook, then you need to paste that link into Drafts action in replacement to “paste Zapier webhook” and it should work well. In automate.io you need to create a database item, select database and that should send drafts to your DB.

It would be great to be able to have better formatting - it pastes as 1 block, and to be able to pick template, so there is room to improve, but you can move content easilly

item.title: Integrating Drafts with Notion using Automate.io
item.dc:creator: agiletortoise
item.description:
I haven’t used Automate.io, but looks pretty similar to Zapier. I imagine the setup would be pretty similar, as they seem to support both Webhook and email triggers for automation.

I’d start by looking at the Zapier integration guide and see if those ideas translate cleanly.
